frame.name: Reserving
frame.definition:
<def-root>LUs in this frame denote a scenario in which a <fen>Client</fen> arranges to retain the <fen>Services</fen> of an <fen>Organization</fen> at a later <fen>Time</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Client">Patrick</fex> tried to <t>reserve</t> <fex name="Services">a table</fex> <fex name="Organization">at Dorsia</fex> <fex name="Time"> for 7:00</fex>, but they were booked solid.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Client
FE.definition: <def-root>The entity that contacts the <fen>Organization</fen> about retainment of <fen>Services</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Services
FE.definition: <def-root>The goods or labor that the <fen>Client</fen> requests the <fen>Organization</fen> preserve for future consumption or rendering.</def-root>

FE.name: Organization
FE.definition: <def-root>The entity that enters into its records the request of the <fen>Client</fen> to retain <fen>Services</fen> in the future.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The future point in time when the <fen>Client</fen> arranges for the <fen>Organization</fen> to provide <fen>Services</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Beneficiary
FE.definition:
<def-root>In cases where the the <fen>Client</fen> makes a reservation on the behalf of another party, the entity for whom the reservation is made is the <fen>Beneficiary</fen>.
<ex>Phil Collins booked his <fex name="Beneficiary">cockatoo</fex> into a $350-a-night pet hotel.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Booker
FE.definition: <def-root>The link between the <fen>Client</fen> and <fen>Organization</fen>, e.g. a travel agent.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: reserve.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: arrange for (a seat, ticket, etc.) to be kept for the use of a particular person.

lexUnit.name: reservation.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action of reserving. > an arrangement whereby something has been reserved.
